question_text: If 2q35 = 778, find q
subject: mathematics

question_text: Simplify \(\frac{3\frac{2}{3} \times \frac{5}{6} \times \frac{2}{3}}{\frac{11}{15} \times \frac{3}{4} \times \frac{2}{27}}\)
subject: mathematics

question_text: A man invested ₦5,000 for 9 months at 4%. What is the simple interest?
subject: mathematics
explanation: S.I. = \(\frac{P \times R \times T}{100}\) If T = 9 months, it is equivalent to \(\frac{9}{12}\) years S.I. = \(\frac{5000 \times 4 \times 9}{100 \times 12}\) S.I. = ₦150

question_text: If the numbers M, N, Q are in the ratio 5:4:3, find the value of \(\frac{2N - Q}{M}\)
subject: mathematics
explanation: M:N:Q == 5:4:3 i.e M = 5, N = 4, Q = 3 Substituting values into equation, we have... \(\frac{2N - Q}{M}\) = \(\frac{2(4) - 3}{5}\) = \(\frac{8 - 3}{5}\) = \(\frac{5}{5}\) = 1

question_text: If log318 + log33 - log3x = 3, Find x.
subject: mathematics

question_text: Rationalize \(\frac{2 - \sqrt5}{3 - \sqrt5}\)
subject: mathematics

question_text: Simplify (\(\sqrt2 + \frac{1}{\sqrt3})(\sqrt2 - \frac{1}{\sqrt3}\))
subject: mathematics

question_text: Raial has 7 different posters to be hanged in her bedroom, living room and kitchen. Assuming she has plans to place at least a poster in each of the 3 rooms, how many choices does she have?
subject: mathematics
explanation: The first poster has 7 ways to be arranges, the second poster can be arranged in 6 ways and the third poster in 5 ways.  = 7 x 6 x 5  = 210 ways  or \(\frac{7}{P_3}\) = \(\frac{7!}{(7 - 3)!}\) = \(\frac{7!}{4!}\) = \(\frac{7 \times 6 \times 5 \times 4!}{4!}\)  = 210 ways

question_text: Make R the subject of the formula if T = \(\frac {KR^2 + M}{3}\)
subject: mathematics
explanation: T = \(\frac{KR^2 + M}{3}\) 3T = KR2 + M  KR2 = 3T - M R2 = \(\frac{3T - M}{K}\) R = \(\sqrt\frac{3T - M}{K}\)

question_text: Find the remainder when X3 - 2X2 + 3X - 3 is divided by X2 + 1
subject: mathematics

question_text: Factorize completely 9y2 - 16X2
subject: mathematics

question_text: Solve for x and y respectively in the simultaneous equations -2x - 5y = 3, x + 3y = 0
subject: mathematics

question_text: If x varies directly as square root of y and x = 81 when y = 9, Find x when y = 1\(\frac{7}{9}\)
subject: mathematics
explanation: x \(\alpha\sqrt y\) x = k\(\sqrt y\) 81 = k\(\sqrt9\) k = \(\frac{81}{3}\) = 27 therefore, x = 27\(\sqrt y\)  y = 1\(\frac{7}{9}\) = \(\frac{16}{9}\) x = 27 x \(\sqrt{\frac{16}{9}}\) = 27 x \(\frac{4}{3}\) dividing 27 by 3  = 9 x 4  = 36

question_text: T varies inversely as the cube of R. When R = 3, T = \(\frac{2}{81}\), find T when R = 2
subject: mathematics

question_text: Solve the inequality x2 + 2x > 15.
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find the sum of the first 18 terms of the series 3, 6, 9,..., 36.
subject: mathematics

question_text: The seconds term of a geometric series is 4 while the fourth term is 16. Find the sum of the first five terms
subject: mathematics

question_text: A binary operation \(\oplus\) om real numbers is defined by x \(\oplus\) y = xy + x + y for two real numbers x and y. Find the value of 3 \(\oplus\) - \(\frac{2}{3}\).
subject: mathematics

question_text: If | 2 3 | = | 4 1 |. find the value of y. 7
subject: mathematics

question_text: Evaluate \(\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 2 & -1 \\ 2 & 3 & -1 \\ -1 & 1 & 3 \end{vmatrix}\)
subject: mathematics

question_text: The inverse of matrix N = \(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 \\  1 & 4\end{vmatrix}\) is
subject: mathematics
explanation: N = [2 3] N-1 = \(\frac{adj N}{|N|}\) adj N = \(\begin{vmatrix} 4 & -3 \\ -1 & 2 \end{vmatrix}\) |N| = (2 x4) - (1 x 3) = 8 - 3  =5  N-1 = \(\frac {1}{5}\) \(\begin{vmatrix} 4 & -3 \\ -1 & 2 \end{vmatrix}\)

question_text: What is the size of each interior angle of a 12-sided regular polygon?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Interior angle = (n - 2)180 but, n = 12 = (12 -2)180  = 10 x 180  = 1800 let each interior angle = x  x = \(\frac{(n - 2)180}{n}\) x = \(\frac{1800}{12}\) = 150o

question_text: A circle of perimeter 28cm is opened to form a square. What is the maximum possible area of the square?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Perimeter of circle = Perimeter of square  28cm = 4L L = \(\frac{28}{4}\) = 7cm Area of square = L2 = 72 = 49cm2

question_text: A chord of circle of radius 7cm is 5cm from the centre of the maximum possible area of the square?
subject: mathematics
explanation: From Pythagoras theorem |OA|2 = |AN|2 + |ON|2 72 = |AN|2 + (5)2 49 = |AN|2 + 25 |AN|2 = 49 - 25 = 24 |AN| = \(\sqrt {24}\)  = \(\sqrt {4 \times 6}\) = 2√6 cm  |AN| = |NB| (A line drawn from the centre of a circle to a chord, divides the chord into two equal parts)  |AN| + |NB| = |AB| 2√6 + 2√6 = |AB| |AB| = 4√6 cm

question_text: A solid metal cube of side 3 cm is placed in a rectangular tank of dimension 3, 4 and 5 cm. What volume of water can the tank now hold
subject: mathematics
explanation: Volume of cube = L3 33 = 27cm3 volume of rectangular tank = L x B X h  = 3 x 4 x 5  = 60cm3 volume of H2O the tank can now hold  = volume of rectangular tank - volume of cube  = 60 - 27  = 33cm3

question_text: The perpendicular bisector of a line XY is the locus of a point B. whose distance from Y is always twice its distance from X. C
subject: mathematics

options.answer: whose distance from X is always twice its distance from Y
whose distance from Y is always twice its distance from X.
which moves on the line XY
which is equidistant from the points X and y

question_text: The midpoint of P(x, y) and Q(8, 6). Find x and y. midpoint = (5, 8)
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find the equation of a line perpendicular to line 2y = 5x + 4 which passes through (4, 2).
subject: mathematics
explanation: 2y = 5x + 4 (4, 2) y = \(\frac{5x}{2}\) + 4 comparing with y = mx + e  m = \(\frac{5}{2}\) Since they are perpendicular  m1m2 = -1 m2 = \(\frac{-1}{m_1}\) = -1 \(\frac{5}{2}\) = -1 x \(\frac{2}{5}\) The equator of the line is thus  y = mn + c (4, 2) 2 = -\(\frac{2}{5}\)(4) + c  \(\frac{2}{1}\) + \(\frac{8}{5}\) = c c = \(\frac{18}{5}\) \(\frac{10 + 5}{5}\) = c  y = -\(\frac{2}{5}\)x + \(\frac{18}{5}\) 5y = -2x + 18  or 5y + 2x - 18 = 0

question_text: In a right angled triangle, if tan \(\theta\) = \(\frac{3}{4}\). What is cos\(\theta\) - sin\(\theta\)?
subject: mathematics
explanation: tan\(\theta\) = \(\frac{3}{4}\) from Pythagoras tippet, the hypotenus is T i.e. 3, 4, 5.  then sin \(\theta\) = \(\frac{3}{5}\) and cos\(\theta\) = \(\frac{4}{3}\) cos\(\theta\) - sin\(\theta\)  \(\frac{4}{5}\) - \(\frac{3}{5}\) = \(\frac{1}{5}\)

question_text: A man walks 100 m due West from a point X to Y, he then walks 100 m due North to a point Z. Find the bearing of X from Z.
subject: mathematics
explanation: tan\(\theta\) = \(\frac{100}{100}\) = 1  \(\theta\) = tan-1(1) = 45o The bearing of x from z is ₦45oE or 135o

question_text: The derivatives of (2x + 1)(3x + 1) is
subject: mathematics

question_text: \(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Class Intervals} & 0 - 2 & 3 - 5 & 6 - 8 & 9 - 11 & \\ \hline \text{Frequency} & 3 & 2 & 5 & 3 &\end{array}\)Find the mode of the above distribution.
subject: mathematics
explanation: Mode = L1 + (\(\frac{D_1}{D_1 + D_2}\))C D1 = frequency of modal class - frequency of the class before it  D1 = 5 - 2 = 3 D2 = frequency of modal class - frequency of the class that offers it  D2 = 5 - 3 = 2 L1 = lower class boundary of the modal class L1 = 5 - 5  C is the class width = 8 - 5.5 = 3  Mode = L1 + (\(\frac{D_1}{D_1 + D_2}\))C = 5.5 + \(\frac{3}{2 + 3}\)C = 5.5 + \(\frac{3}{5}\) x 3  = 5.5 + \(\frac{9}{5}\) = 5.5 + 1.8  = 7.3 \(\approx\) = 7

question_text: Find the value of x at the minimum point of the curve y = x3 + x2 - x + 1
subject: mathematics
explanation: y = x3 + x2 - x + 1  \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = \(\frac{d(x^3)}{dx}\) + \(\frac{d(x^2)}{dx}\) - \(\frac{d(x)}{dx}\) + \(\frac{d(1)}{dx}\) \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 3x2 + 2x - 1 = 0  \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 3x2 + 2x - 1  At the maximum point \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 0 3x2 + 2x - 1 = 0  (3x2 + 3x) - (x - 1) = 0  3x(x + 1) -1(x + 1) = 0 (3x - 1)(x + 1) = 0  therefore x = \(\frac{1}{3}\) or -1  For the maximum point  \(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) < 0 \(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) 6x + 2  when x = \(\frac{1}{3}\) \(\frac{dx^2}{dx^2}\) = 6(\(\frac{1}{3}\)) + 2  = 2 + 2 = 4 \(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) > o which is the minimum point  when x = -1  \(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) = 6(-1) + 2  = -6 + 2 = -4 -4 < 0 therefore, \(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) < 0 the maximum point is -1

question_text: Evaluate \(\int^{1}_{2}\)(3 - 2x)dx
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find \(\int^{1}_{0}\) cos4 x dx
subject: mathematics
explanation: \(\int^{1}_{0}\) cos4 x dx let u = 4x  \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 4  dx = \(\frac{dy}{4}\) \(\int^{1}_{0}\)cos u. \(\frac{dy}{4}\) = \(\frac{1}{4}\)\(\int\)cos u du = \(\frac{1}{4}\) sin u + k = \(\frac{1}{4}\) sin4x + k

question_text: The sum of four consecutive integers is 34. Find the least of these numbers
subject: mathematics
explanation: Let the numbers be a, a + 1, a + 2, a + 3 a + a + 1 + a + 2 + a + 3 = 34 4a = 34 - 6 4a = 28 a = \(\frac{28}{4}\)  = 7 The least of these numbers is a = 7

question_text: \(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{No} & 0 & 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\ \hline \text{Frequency} & 1 & 4 & 3 & 8 & 2 & 5 \end{array}\).From the table above, find the median and range of the data respectively.
subject: mathematics

question_text: \(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Class Interval} & 3 - 5 & 6 - 8 & 9 - 11 \\ \hline \text{Frequency} & 2 & 2 & 2 \end{array}\).Find the standard deviation of the above distribution.
subject: mathematics

question_text: I how many was can the letters of the word ELATION be arranged?
subject: mathematics
explanation: ELATION Since there are 7 letters. The first letter can be arranged in 7 ways, , the second letter in 6 ways, the third letter in 5 ways, the 4th letter in four ways, the 3rd letter in three ways, the 2nd letter in 2 ways and the last in one way. therefore, 7 x 6 x 5 x 4 x 3 x 2 x 1 = 7! ways

question_text: In how many ways can five people sit round a circular table?
subject: mathematics
explanation: The first person will sit down and the remaining will join. i.e. (n - 1)! = (5 - 1)! = 4! = 24 ways

question_text: Find the probability that a number picked at random from the set(43, 44, 45, ..., 60) is a prime number.
subject: mathematics
explanation: Prime numbers = (43,47,53,59) N = (43, 44, 45,..., 60) The universal set contains 18 numbers. The prime numbers between 43 and 60 are 4  Probability of picking a prime number = \(\frac{4}{18}\) = \(\frac{2}{9}\)

question_text: In the diagram, STUV is a straight line. < TSY = < UXY = 40o and < VUW = 110o. Calculate < TYW
subject: mathematics
explanation: < TUW = 110\(^{\circ}\) = 180\(^{\circ}\) (< s on a straight line)< TUW = 180\(^{\circ}\) - 110\(^{\circ}\) = 70\(^{\circ}\)In \(\bigtriangleup\) XTU, < XUT + < TXU = 180\(^{\circ}\)i.e. < YTS + 70\(^{\circ}\) = 180< XTU = 180 - 110\(^{\circ}\) = 70\(^{\circ}\)Also < YTS + < XTU = 180 (< s on a straight line)i.e. < YTS + < XTU - 180(< s on straight line)i.e. < YTS + 70\(^{\circ}\) = 180< YTS = 180 - 70 = 110\(^{\circ}\)in \(\bigtriangleup\) SYT + < YST + < YTS = 180\(^{\circ}\)(Sum of interior < s)SYT + 40 + 110 = 180 < SYT = 180 - 150 = 30< SYT = < XYW (vertically opposite < s)Also < SYX = < TYW (vertically opposite < s)but < SYT + < XYW + < SYX + < TYW = 360i.e. 30 + 30 + < SYX + TYW = 360but < SYX = < TYW 60 + 2(< TYW) = 3602(< TYW) = 360\(^{\circ}\) - 602(< TYW) = 300\(^{\circ}\)TYW = \(\frac{300}{2}\) = 150\(^{\circ}\)< SYT
